England Under-21 goalkeeper, Dean Henderson, is set to sign a new deal at Manchester United

quote.msg: England Under-21 goalkeeper, Dean Henderson, is set to sign a new deal at Manchester United

replies.msg:

å¥½ä¼¼ç‡ç·Šç¬¬äºŒå€‹ç›§å¡å¤å’

TeamTalk are quoting reports from Germany as saying:

“He is keen to move up in the career, he loves the Premier League and is ready to join Manchester United – his favourite club.

“Philipp is the best (left back in Germany) and at his peak now, Augsburg would want around €40m.”

The €40 million fee equates to £35 million – not a ridiculous price in today’s market, but Philipp Max has not played Champions League football nor represented his country at senior international level.

The full-back was in the Bayern Munich youth team before transferring to Schalke 04 in 2010. He made his debut in the fierce Revierderby against Borussia Dortmund four years later.

replies.msg:
What is holding up the Fred transfer?

United and Shakhtar announced they had agreed a fee believed to be around £47m for the transfer of Fred last week after the Brazilian had passed his medical at Carrington.

Unusually, the announcement has been split in two. There were no announcement videos, quotes or unveiling photos like we have come to expect with new signings at United.

But Fred’s work permit application is still being processed. It should only be a mere formality and expect the deal to be wrapped up in the coming days.

Source: Manchester Evening News

Mancherster United would like to put on record our regret over recent media speculation regarding Atletico Madrid and player transfers between the two clubs.

We apologise to the owner, board of directors and fans of Atletico Madrid for any misunderstanding regarding Antoine Griezmann.

We respect Atletico Madrid's position and can confirm we have ended any interest in the player.

JUVE CLOSE ON UNITED TARGET

Juventus are closing in on Manchester United target Aleksandr Golovin, with the Serie A champions in advanced talks with CSKA Moscow, according to Corriere dello Sport.

The 22-year-old is set to feature for Russia in the opening match of the World Cup against Saudi Arabia on Thursday.

Juventus are believed to have been tracking Golovin for the last six months and are hopeful on completing the deal ahead of reported suitors United, Chelsea, Arsenal and Monaco.
